ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: When problem sets were due, I spent 10-30 hours outside of class on this course.
20 hours per week
6 hours.
6 hours
8 hour
~15-20 hours in the weeks that the problem sets were due.
10 hours
5-8 hours.
5 hours

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: A lot of outside work was required for this course, but that work translated into a level of understanding of the material that would not have been achieved otherwise. This is the best course I have experienced in learning Bayesian Statistics.
Strength: Nice topics Weakness: Lecture notes sometimes are not specifics.
It was often hard to translate the material we went over in class to the homework assignments, exam, and coding.
A great introductory course in Bayesian statistics.
The course was well designed. I was sometimes hard to follow the contents in the presentation slides. The examples Joshua used were helpful to catch up with them.

Concepts learnt from this course were very useful. The course was well organized. Homework assignments related to course material closely. I really like the format of the final projects. It would be better to upload scores assignments and exams to canvas, to I can get timely feedback. And the 8:00am course was too early. :(
strength: cover the bayesian statistics in detail. no weakness
Very useful course for research; highly recommended.
This is a really great class in bayesian statistics. I learned a lot from Professor Warren.

The course was very well taught. The instructor is engaging and extremely willing to be available for questions outside of class time, which was unique and definitely a highlight of this class. The topic of the course is fascinating and useful, and the variety of final projects illustrated this and were very interesting. The only suggestion I might have is that there were many interesting applications introduced in lecture that were not necessary covered on the problem sets - in order to have a better grasp of those applications, it might have been interesting to have some optional problems to think about of the problem sets (perhaps extra credit?).

Strengths: In-depth introduction to Bayesian statistics. Josh is an excellent professor, very willing to explain things during office hours. Weaknesses: Focuses more on theory than application (may be a strength depending on what you hope to get out of the class). Definitely difficult, be weary if you don't have a strong math background.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Joshua L. Warren  Instructor was extremely responsive and helpful, especially during office hours.
Instructor: Joshua L. Warren  Joshua cares about his students. Wonderful professor.
Instructor: Joshua L. Warren  Professor Warren is very nice and intelligent. He is very patient with students.
Instructor: Joshua L. Warren  Extremely helpful with any and all questions
Instructor: Joshua L. Warren  Great and very helpful! Thank you!
Instructor: Joshua L. Warren  Prof. Warren cares about students. He gave feedback really fast and convey the ideas clearly.

Instructor: Joshua L. Warren  Joshua has sufficient experience with the course's contents. His advice is very accurate. If he spoke a little bit more distinctly, I would figure out which part is core and which is side issue.
Instructor: Joshua L. Warren  Josh was a great instructor. His lectures were well organized and easy to follow. He is very responsive to questions.
Instructor: Joshua L. Warren  The instructor gave well-organized lecture.
Instructor: Joshua L. Warren  Very good instructor. Knowledgeable and inspired!
Instructor: Joshua L. Warren  Professor Warren is very friendly and helpful, and very responsive to students' questions. I also like his teaching style a lot, very detailed and clear.

Instructor: Joshua L. Warren  As I mentioned in a previous question, one of the definite highlights of the course is that the instructor was very available for questions outside of class time and clearly excited about the material he was teaching. This was inspiring and made the learning process very enjoyable.
Instructor: Joshua L. Warren  Excellent professor. Extremely patient and willing to work with and help students. Make sure to take advantage of office hours. This cannot be emphasized enough.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Great course if ever planning to do Bayesian work!

I would highly recommend this course to a fellow student, but with the stipulation that the student have a strong foundation in biostatistics and R programming and be willing to commit a lot of time to learning the materials for this course.
Valuable course
Great introductory bayesian class that focuses on computational part.
Yes
I'd recommend this course to the students who want to study Bayesian statistics and its application.

I would recommend it too other students. The course teaches important and fundamental topics related to Bayesian inference. I've learnt statistical concepts and techniques that I think would be lifetime useful.
The course gives a full introduction to bayesian statistics. The material covered by the course is useful in my daily research. I would recommend it to another student.
Useful course! Recommend!
This is a very interesting class and the methodology covered in this class may be very useful, dependent on the student's interest. I highly recommend it.
See question 6.
Overall its a good course
Theory and some application behind Bayesian statistics. Make sure you have a strong math background if you plan to take this class.
